title: Theodore Roosevelt Inaugural National Historic Site: Safety
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Safety            Safety        The Theodore Roosevelt Inaugural National Historic Site is an urban park in Buffalo, NY.  Please remember to: -Watch your step on uneven pavement, including some historic sandstone walkways and a gravel drive. -Use care crossing busy intersections. -Keep valuables in your car out of sight. -Lock your car. In addition, please take note that: -the Delaware Avenue entrance to the parking lot is one-way only.  All exits must be to Franklin Street. -Franklin Street is one-way northbound.  When exiting the lot, you MUST turn left.   For the safety and enjoyment of all visitors, please: -place trash in trash bins, or take it with you. -keep bicycles off the sidewalk.
